question: Why Java is Partially OOP language?
answer: It supports usual declaration of primitive data types

question: Which among the following doesn’t come under OOP concept?

answer: class derived_classname : access base_classname{ /*define class body*/ };

question: The feature by which one object can interact with another object is _____________
In object-oriented programming, objects are instances of classes.
Encapsulation is a principle that combines data and methods into a single unit called an object.
Inheritance allows a class to inherit properties and methods from another class
Polymorphism refers to the ability of an object to take on many forms and respond differently based on the context.
Abstraction is the process of hiding complex implementation details and exposing only essential features to the user.
Object-oriented programming is limited to only a few programming languages and cannot be used in web development.
In object-oriented programming, multiple inheritance allows a class to inherit from multiple classes.
Objects communicate with each other by sending messages and receiving responses.
Object-oriented programming promotes reusability of code through the concept of classes and objects
Object-oriented programming is a programming paradigm that focuses on the procedural execution of code.
